pages.text: Basin is a processing device. Basin has three working modes: $(l:processing/basin#heating)"heating"$(), $(l:processing/basin#squeezing)"squeezing"$() and $(l:processing/basin#throwing)"contact"$().$(br2)They come with two variants: wooden and earthen. Only $(em)earthen basins$() are capable to handle distillation. $(br2)Right-clicking basin allows you to put items/fluid in and take them out.

pages.title: Contact
pages.text: "Contact" simply means that you just throw items into basin, and it will mix up with fluid inside the basin and become another item.

pages.title: Heating
pages.text: "Heating" means that you need to heat the fluid inside the basin to get refined products. Only $(em)earthen basins$() are capable to handle heating. To heat fluid, you need a heat source. Typical heat sources include lava and fire (as shown on the right-hand side). Sunlight also works here - so long as the basin can directly see the sun.

pages.title: Squeezing
pages.text: Squeezing is a bit complicated. It means that you need to put items into basin by right clicking basin, then either put a vanilla piston on the basin to form a squeezer (see diagram on your right), or use your feet to crush them by let yourself jump and fall on the basin.$(br2)The squeezer structure only needs $(em)redstone pulse$() to work.

pages.title: Squeezing
pages.text: Squeezing is a bit complicated. It means that you need to put items into basin by right clicking basin, then either put a vanilla piston on the basin to form a squeezer (see diagram on your right), or use your feet to crush them by let yourself jump and fall on the basin.$(br2)The squeezer structure needs $(em)energy$() to work.
Unlike its earthen counterpart, wooden basin has only one variant: the one with oak wood texture. Wooden Basin cannot be heated.
Want colored basins? Replace terracotta with colored terracotta. Although technically this entry ends here, if you feel bored, you can still browse the rest of pages of this entry.
